title: Jack & Joker: U Steal My Heart!
info: Jack & Joker: U Steal My Heart! (ทําไมต้องเป็นเธอทุกที) is a 2024 Thai television series starring Anan Wong (Yin) and Wanarat Ratsameerat (War). Directed by Bundit Sintanaparadee (Tee) and co-produced by Channel 3 and iQIYI, it officially premiered on September 9, 2024 on Channel 3, airing on Mondays at 10:45pm IST (10:45pm). It ended on November 25, 2024, after 12 episodes. A special episode was released on February 22, 2025.
reception: Jack & Joker received positive reviews for its chemistry between leads, character development, and mix of humor and emotional depth. The series trended regularly on Thai Twitter and became one of iQIYI Thailand’s most-watched BL titles in Q1 2024.

title: Our Golden Days
info: Our Golden Days () is an ongoing South Korean television series directed by Kim Hyung-seok and starring Jung Il-woo, Jung In-sun, Chun Ho-jin, and Lee Tae-ran. Written by So Hyun-kyung, it tells the story of older and new generations who discover the true meaning of family by learning to understand and share each other’s pain. It premiered on KBS2 on August 9, 2025, and airs every Saturday and Sunday at 20:00 (KST). The series is available for streaming on Viu in Singapore and Hong Kong.

title: Love Mechanics
info: Love Mechanics (; ) is a 2022 Thai romantic drama television series directed by Lit Phadung Samajarn and starring Anan Wong (Yin) and Wanarat Ratsameerat (War). It is an expanded adaptation of the popular 2020 mini-series En of Love: Love Mechanics, which was part of the En of Love anthology. The series aired as a WeTV Original every Saturday at 9:00 PM (21:00) from June 18, 2022, to August 6, 2022, on WeTV.
reception: Love Mechanics garnered significant attention and positive feedback from viewers, particularly for its portrayal of a complex romantic relationship and the strong chemistry between the lead actors, Yin Anan Wong and War Wanarat Ratsameerat. The series achieved substantial viewership of the original En of Love project on LINE TV, which accumulated 40 million views across its eight episodes, including Love Mechanics. The final episode of Love Mechanics alone attracted 500,000 views within hours of...

title: You Shou Yan
info: You Shou Yan (), also known as Fabulous Beasts, is a Chinese comedy manhua and animated series (donghua) created by Xue Xia Mao Yao Zi () with animation by and published by Bilibili. The story features various beasts from Chinese mythology, many of which take the form of anthropomorphic animals. It is compiled in 5 books and has been listed on Chinese publisher Xiron's 2022 and 2023 "top 10 best-selling comic books" lists.

title: O-Negative

info: O-Negative (Thai: โอเนกาทีฟ รักออกแบบไม่ได้; RTGS: O-Negative Rak Oak Baep Mai Dai, lit. O-Negative, Love Can't Be Designed) is a 2016 Thai television drama series. It is a television adaptation of the popular 1998 Thai film of the same name. The series aired on GMM 25 and LINE TV from November 30, 2016, to February 23, 2017, consisting of 26 episodes.
reception: The series received attention for its portrayal of youthful friendships and romantic dilemmas. The cast, featuring popular young actors, was praised for their performances in bringing the beloved story to a new generation of viewers.

title: S Line
info: S Line (; stylized as Social. Sex. Secrets.: The S–Lines) is a South Korean dark fantasy crime thriller television series released on Wavve from July 11, to July 25, 2025. The series is based on the original Naver webtoon of the same name by kkomabi and was written and directed by Ahn Joo-young. It stars Lee Soo-hyuk, Lee Da-hee, Arin, Lee Eun-saem, and Kim Dong-young. The drama was invited to compete at the 8th edition of Canneseries.

info: Project Alpha (; stylised in all caps) is a 2022 Thai reality competition show produced by GMMTV. It premiered on GMM25 and the show's YouTube channel on December 4, 2022, and aired on Sundays at 20:30 ICT. Twenty eight contestants were selected for the show and were split into two categories in the first episode; Alpha and Beta. The show finale was broadcast live on March 5, 2023, with the announcement of the final lineup who would debut as LYKN.

info: The Resurrected () is a 2026 Taiwanese Netflix original series directed by Chao-jen Hsu and Leste Chen. The series starring Shu Qi and Lee Sinje, set in the fictional city of Benkha is about two grieving mothers, who revive a scam ringleader to avenge their daughters. The first two episodes of the series premiered at the 30th Busan International Film Festival in the 'On Screen' section on September 18, 2025. It was made available to stream on Netflix on October 9, 2025 globally.

title: Back In Time
genre: Coming of age, Teen drama, romance novel
info: Back In Time () is a 2014 Chinese television series based on the novel "Cong Cong Na Nian" by Jiu Ye Hui. The series stars newcomers Yang Le, He Hongshan, Bai Jingting, Cai Wenjing, and Du Weihan. On 4 August 2014, the television adaptation premiered on Sohu. The series depicts five classmates as they navigate love, friendship, and the challenges of maturing. The film version Fleet of Time was released in Beijing on 30 July 2014.
reception: The series has been praised for its well-crafted script, realistic characters, and impressive cinematography.<ref></ref> It garnered over 400 million views within a month of its release.<ref></ref>

title: Nice to Not Meet You
info: Nice to Not Meet You () is an upcoming South Korean television series starring Lee Jung-jae, Lim Ji-yeon, Kim Ji-hoon and Seo Ji-hye. It is scheduled to premiere on tvN in November 2025, and will air every Monday and Tuesday at 20:50 (KST).

title: My Troublesome Star
info: My Troublesome Star () is a 2025 South Korean drama series starring Uhm Jung-hwa, Song Seung-heon, Lee El, Oh Dae-hwan, and Jang Da-ah. It aired on ENA to August 18, to September 23, 2025, every Saturday and Sunday at 22:00 (KST). The drama follows the story of a once-celebrated actress who, after a mysterious accident, wakes up 25 years later in a completely different life, embarking on a journey to reclaim her lost stardom. The series is also available for streaming on Viu in selected regions.

For the international version is also available on iQIYI and Netflix.

title: Ball Boy Tactics
info: Ball Boy Tactics () is a 2025 South Korean romantic sports miniseries directed by Kim Eun-hye. The show consists of eight episodes and originally aired on Heavenly, with international distribution through GagaOOLala and iQIYI. It stars Choi Jae-hyeok and Yeom Min-hyeok.
reception: Ball Boy Tactics received positive feedback from viewers, especially for the chemistry between the leads and its sensitive portrayal of queer romance. The teaser was well received, highlighting romantic tension between the protagonists. A kiss scene between the leads also drew attention online, described as "very hot" by fans and critics.<ref><!-- auto-translated from Portuguese by Module:CS1 translator --></ref> The series was listed among the most anticipated K-Dram...

title: This Thriving Land
genre: China Internet Information Center, Historical drama
producer: Bandao Broadcasting Media Corporation Bandao News
info: This Thriving Land () is a 2025 Chinese television series written by Wang He, directed by Liu Jiacheng and starring Yang Mi and Ou Hao. It is adapted from the novel Qian Quan Yu Jue Jue by Zhao Defa. This Thriving Land achieved phenomenal ratings success, breaking viewership records for its broadcaster and becoming the first Chinese television drama of 2025 to achieve a single-day playback of over 100 million, with a market share exceeding 46.1%. It revived public interest in the Chinese medicin...
reception: On Yang Mi's portrayal of the character Ning Xiuxiu, Zhao Defa, the novel's author the series is based on, wrote: "She brought Xiuxiu to life. Her nuanced depiction of Xiuxiu's shock and loneliness after misfortune, her bewilderment and hatred toward her father, lingering feelings for Fei Wendian, gradual acceptance and growing affection for Dajiao, as well as her learning and integration into farm life—all were portrayed with meticulous detail."<ref></ref>

title: The Woman Who Swallowed the Sun
genre: Crime thriller, Korean melodrama, Revenge tragedy, Romance film
info: The Woman Who Swallowed the Sun () is an ongoing South Korean television series written by Seol Kyung-eun and directed by Kim Jin-hyun. Produced under MBC C&I, it stars Jang Shin-young, Seo Ha-joon, Yoon A-jung and Oh Chang-seok. The series premiered on MBC TV on June 9, 2025, and airs every Monday to Friday at 19:05 (KST).

title: Super Penguin League
info: Super Penguin League () is a 2018 Chinese live competitive basketball all-star tournament featuring both sports and entertainment celebrities, including former NBA legend Tracy McGrady, Iverson Molinar, Steve Nash, Manu Ginóbili and Tony Parker, noted trainer Ganon Baker, CBA Zhejiang Lions head coach Li Chunjiang, and former Taiwanese international Yen Hsing Su. On 2 August 2018, it was released on Tencent Video. More than 50 prominent personalities from the sports and entertainment industries ...
reception: The dynamics of professional basketball, combined with the creative athleticism and talent of young national artists, offered a refreshing experience that received critical and audience acclaim.<ref></ref> In 2019, singer Jam Hsiao, Ma Jia, and actor Bruce Hung provided entertainment during the competition; the final game garnered over 21 Million viewers on streaming platforms.<ref></ref>

title: I Love Filipino
info: I Love Filipino is a 2025 Philippine documentary series created and directed by Marnie Manicad and hosted by her husband, broadcast journalist Jiggy Manicad. The five-part series was produced by Team MMPI and released on Netflix on June 12, 2025, coinciding with the 127th Philippine Independence Day. The series aims to explore and celebrate Filipino identity and culture by examining various facets of the nation's heritage, including its cuisine, music, art, architecture, and dipping sauces (saws...
reception: The series was generally well-received for its positive portrayal of Filipino culture and its goal of promoting national pride.<ref></ref> Esquire Philippines noted that the series "reignites the conversation on what it means to be Filipino today."<ref></ref> The Manila Times and other outlets highlighted its timely release on Independence Day as a call for Filipinos to reconnect with their roots.<ref></ref><ref></ref>

title: Love for Loves Sake
genre: Boys' Love, Fantasy television, Romantic drama
info: Love for Love’s Sake () is a 2025 South Korean fantasy romance miniseries directed by Kim Kyun Ah and written by Kwon Cho Rong. The series stars Tae Vin, Cha Joo Wan, Oh Min Su, and Cha Woongki. It premiered on July 4, 2025, and was distributed through Netflix, iQIYI, TVING, and Wavve.
reception: Love for Love’s Sake received positive attention for its unique premise and emotional depth. It was praised for its portrayal of queer relationships and virtual storytelling. The series was listed among the most anticipated K-Dramas of July 2025 and gained traction across streaming platforms.

title: Bad Genius
info: Bad Genius is a Philippine crime thriller series directed by Derick Cabrido and starring Atasha Muhlach, Jairus Aquino, Gab Lagman, and Hyacinth Callado. It is the Philippine television adaptation of the 2017 Thai film of the same name. It premiered on Viva One on July 17, 2025 with new episodes released every Friday until October 10, 2025.

title: The Underclass
info: The Underclass (; ) is a 2020 Thai teen drama television series directed by Pass Patthanakumjon and produced by GMM Studios International together with Tifa Studios, starring Nannaphas Loetnamchoetsakun (Mewnich), Praewa Suthamphong (Music), Sumitta Duangkaew (Fye), Tanutchai Wijitvongtong (Mond) and several other members of BNK48. The story follows an A class student who is caught cheating on an exam, leading to her transfer to the disadvantaged Class F. It aired every Sunday on GMM25 and Netfl...

title: Moon River
genre: Comedy film, Fantasy television, Melodrama, Romance film, Sageuk
producer: Pl Han Seok Won Hwang Gi Yong Yoon Hong Mi
info: Moon River () is an upcoming South Korean television series starring Kang Tae-oh, and Kim Se-jeong. It is scheduled to premiere on MBC TV on November 7, 2025, and airs every Friday and Saturday at 21:50 (KST).

title: Memoir of Rati
genre: Boys' love, Historical drama, Romance film
info: Memoir of Rati (; ) is a 2025 Thai television series directed by Natchanit Jirarungroj, starring Sapol Assawamunkong (Great) and Sarin Ronnakiat (Inn). Adapted from the novel of the same name by P.PICHA (พลอยพิชา) and produced by GMMTV together with Cholumpi Production, it was announced as one of the television series of GMMTV for 2025 during their "GMMTV2025: RIDING THE WAVE" event held on November 26, 2024. This series aired on GMM25 and Netflix from June 20 to September 5, 2025.

title: School Tales The Series
genre: Anthology series, Horror (genre), Teen drama, Thriller (genre), fantasy (genre), mystery (genre)
info: School Tales The Series (; ; lit. There is a Ghost School that...) is a Thai mystery thriller anthology television series created by Five Star Company. Based on eight popular horror stories, the series follows various events that can happen on the school at night. The series was released globally on Netflix on August 10, 2022.

title: Woman
actors: Hikari Mitsushima, Moeno Sumida, Rio Suzuki, Shun Oguri, Yūko Tanaka, Kaoru Kobayashi, Fumi Nikaido, Rumi Hiiragi, Mitsuki Tanimura, Takahiro Miura, Issey Takahashi, Takashi Inoue, Rio Suzuda, Asami Usuda, Tatsuya Kose, Aito Takada, Takugo Ihara, Okayama Hajime, Koichi Yajima
info: Woman , also known as Woman - My Life for My Children is a Japanese television drama that aired on Nippon Television between 3 July and 11 September 2013, starring Hikari Mitsushima. The series included the staff of the network's popular 2010 drama Mother. The drama was also the first to have a preview available online before its airing on over-the-air television, limited to an audience of 10,000 viewers.

title: Blood River
info: Blood River (), formerly known as Tales of Dark River, is a Chinese television series starring Gong Jun and directed by Yin Tao. Adapted from the wuxia novel An He Zhuan () by Zhou Munan, the story follows the assassin Su Muyu (苏暮雨) as he strives to pull Blood River guild out of the shadows and forge a new destiny, free from being anyone’s blade. The drama premiered on Youku on October 20, 2025.

title: Judge Lee Han-young
director: Pl Lee Jae Jin Park Mi Yeon
info: Judge Lee Han-young () is an upcoming South Korean television series starring Ji Sung, Park Hee-soon, Won Jin-ah and Baek Jin-hee. It is scheduled to premiere on MBC TV in the second half of 2025, and will air every Friday and Saturday at 21:50 (KST).

title: The Dream Life of Mr. Kim
info: The Dream Life of Mr. Kim () is an ongoing South Korean television series starring Ryu Seung-ryong, Myung Se-bin, and Cha Kang-yoon. It premiered on JTBC on October 25, 2025, and airs every Saturday at 22:40 (KST) and Sunday at 22:30 (KST). It also streams globally on Netflix.

title: Kamen Rider ZEZTZ
genre: Action film, Crime fiction, Spy-fi_(subgenre), Superhero fiction, Supernatural fiction, Tokusatsu
producer: Takehiro Ōkawa Small Keisuke Shibataka Small Toshinari Yanaka Small Yōsuke Minato Small Sōta Takasaki Small
info: is a Japanese tokusatsu television series, the 36th entry of Toei Company's Kamen Rider metaseries, and the seventh series to debut during the Reiwa era. The series premeired on September 7, 2025, joining No.1 Sentai Gozyuger in the Super Hero Time lineup after the finale of Kamen Rider Gavv. The overall themes of the series are dreams and spy technology. It is the first Kamen Rider series to have a global simulcast alongside its domestic Japanese release.

title: Thailand Music Countdown
info: Thailand Music Countdown () it is a music program that True CJ Creations bought the rights to the M Countdown program from CJ E&M of South Korea to produce in a Thai format, with Exit Three Six Five Company Limited as the program's producer. It opens up space for Thai pop artists to show their potential and promote their new music through stage performances to push the Thai pop music industry. It first aired on May 12, 2024 on Channel 3 HD Currently, 2 seasons have aired. In August 2025 the show...

title: Ploy's Yearbook
info: Ploy's Yearbook (; ) is a 2024 Thai television series starring Tipnaree Weerawatnodom (Namtan), Sutatta Udomsilp (PunPun), Sarunchana Apisamaimongkol (Aye), Rachanun Mahawan (Film), Juthapich Indrajundra (Jamie), Pirapat Watthanasetsiri (Earth), Jitaraphol Potiwihok (Jimmy), Pathompong Reonchaidee (Toy), Archen Aydin (Joong) and Tanutchai Wijitvongtong (Mond). Based on five novels by five Thai authors, the series follows five girls named Ploy in the same classroom who discover that their phone n...

title: Anonymous Signal
genre: Action television, Mystery fiction, Police procedural, Suspense
actors: Joel Chan, Moon Lau, Owen Cheung, Tiffany Lau, Jazz Lam, Karl Ting, Mary Hon, Brian Tse, Rosita Kwok, Amy Fan, Stephanie Au, Cheung Kwok Keung, Lesley Chung, Bob Cheung
info: Anonymous Signal (; lit. Fatal Warning) is a Hong Kong police procedural television series created and produced by TVB. Directed by Jazz Boon, it premiered on 17 March 2025 and ran for 30 episodes until 25 April 2025. Set against the backdrop of police investigations, the series blends action, suspense, and occasional comedic elements, starring Joel Chan, Moon Lau, Owen Cheung, and Tiffany Lau. The story follows police officers as they tackle a range of complex crimes while decoding mysterious p...

title: KPopped
info: KPopped (stylized in all caps) is a music reality competition television series that premiered on Apple TV+ on August 29, 2025. Produced by CJ ENM and Eureka Productions, the series pairs Western recording artists with K-pop idols to reimagine the artists' most popular songs in a K-pop style. Each episode culminates in head-to-head song battles judged by a live audience in Seoul. The show stars Psy and Megan Thee Stallion and is hosted by Soojeong Son. Stallion additionally serves as an executiv...
reception: Hannah J Davies of The Guardian gave the series three out of five stars, describing it as "harmless but largely vibeless" and "a fairly blatant attempt to cash in on the ubiquity of K-pop." She also noted that it lacked the tension and unpredictability typically associated with music competition shows.<ref name="Davies"/>

title: Love in the Moonlight
genre: Boys' Love, Period drama, Romantic drama
info: Love in the Moonlight (; ) is a 2025 Thai boys' love (BL) drama series that aired on One 31 and is also available for streaming on GagaOOLala. The series stars Peemapol Panichtamrong (Peak), Satjakorn Chalard (Pearl), and Veerinsara Tangkitsuvanich (Perth) in lead roles.
reception: Love in the Moonlight received generally positive reviews from viewers. On the drama database site MyDramaList, the series holds a rating of 8.6 out of 10, based on 1,441 user votes. On IMDb, it has an average score of 8.8 out of 10, with 110 user ratings as of October 2025.<ref></ref><ref name="trueid"></ref>

title: No Next Life
producer: Ahn Seok Jun Jeong Hoe Seok Hong Seung Cheol Kim Ji Yeon Yoo Sun Mi Park Chae Won
info: No Next Life () is an upcoming South Korean comedy drama television series, starring Kim Hee-sun, Han Hye-jin, and Jin Seo-yeon. it is scheduled to premiere on TV Chosun on November 10, 2025, and airs every Monday and Tuesday at 10:00 (KST), It will be available to stream on Netflix.

title: Live Long and Prosper
director: Ding Hei Fu Cexin Zheng Junmo
info: Live Long and Prosper () is an upcoming period fantasy Chinese television drama. The series is directed by Ding Hei, Fu Cexin, Zheng Junmo, and stars Dylan Wang, Li Qin and Rong Zishan. Live Long and Prosper is based on a non-romance-driven xianxia fantasy web novel Xian Yu Fei Sheng () by Chonguan Andu on Jinjiang Literature City. It is scheduled for release by Hunan Satellite TV and Mango TV.

title: Lover Merman
info: Lover Merman () is a 2025 Thai romantic fantasy Boys' Love television series produced by G02INFINITY. It is adapted from the web novel Phiang Nawa Lover Merman written by Guy Suwannaroj and Lita P. The series premiered on Channel 7 in Thailand and is available internationally via GagaOOLala. For Thai audiences, it is also accessible on Viki.
reception: The series received mixed to positive reviews. On MyDramaList, it holds a rating of 7.0/10 based on 335 user reviews. On IMDb, it has a score of 6.5/10.<ref></ref> The series has been featured in Thai entertainment outlets for its unique fantasy concept and visual presentation.<ref></ref>

title: Shine
genre: Boys' Love, Historical drama, Romantic drama
director: Khamkwan Duangmanee Panuwat Inthawat Krisda Witthayakhajorndet
info: Shine () is a 2025 Thai romantic historical drama television series produced by Be On Cloud and distributed by WeTV. The series aired weekly on Saturdays from August 2 to September 20, 2025, and was also broadcast on Channel 7. It is scheduled to join the Netflix Thailand catalog on October 31, 2025.
reception: Shine received critical acclaim for its storytelling, performances, and historical depth. Reviewers praised the chemistry between the leads and the series' nuanced portrayal of political and emotional conflict.<ref></ref><ref></ref>

title: My Sweetheart Jom
info: My Sweetheart Jom () is a 2025 Thai romantic comedy Boys' Love television series produced by Idol Factory. It aired on Workpoint TV and was released internationally via the company's official YouTube channel. The series stars Suppapong Udomkaewkanjana (Saint) and Nuttapart Tuntistinchai (Poom) in the lead roles.
reception: *My Sweetheart Jom* received positive feedback from viewers. On MyDramaList, it holds a rating of **7.9/10** based on 2,127 user reviews. On IMDb, the series has a score of **7.7/10** from 200 users.<ref></ref> Critics praised the chemistry between the leads and the series' blend of humor and heartfelt moments.<ref></ref>

title: Love in the Clouds
info: Love in the Clouds () is a 2025 Chinese television series based on the web novel of the same name by Bai Lu Cheng Shuang. It stars Hou Minghao and Lu Yuxiao in leading roles. The series premiered on Youku on October 8, 2025. It is also available for streaming on Netflix, Viki and Viu in selected regions.

title: The Cursed Love
info: The Cursed Love (Thai: รัก สาป สูญ) is a 2025 Thai Boys' Love fantasy drama series produced by Ayu Entertainment. Directed by Mai Phawat Panangkasiri and written by Benjatara and Suphachai Sittiaumponpan, the series premiered on October 8, 2025, airing weekly on Channel 3 and streaming internationally via Ayu Entertainment’s YouTube channel.
reception: The series has drawn attention for its high production value and ambitious fantasy elements. According to Tonboriday, The Cursed Love is among the most expensive Thai BL dramas ever produced, with a budget exceeding 20 million baht.<ref></ref> TrueID praised the series for its visual effects and emotional storytelling.<ref></ref> Kapook highlighted the chemistry between the leads and the integration of Thai mythology.<ref></ref> Thairath and MGR Online also co...

title: In the Name of Blossom
info: In the Name of Blossom () is a 2025 Chinese historical television series directed by Ding Ziguang and produced by Croton Media. It is based on the novel Flourished Peony by Yi Qianchong and stars Yang Zi and Li Xian in the lead roles. It is the second season of the television series Flourished Peony. The series premiered on Mango TV and Migu Video on 30 June. It was released on Hunan Television's Golden Eagle Theatre on 3 July, and ended its run on 19 July.

title: Silent Honor
info: Silent Honor () is a 2025 Chinese spy drama television series. Co-directed by China’s Ministry of State Security and Taiwan Affairs Office, the series is based on the life of Wu Shi and stars Yu Hewei, Wu Yue, Wei Chen, and Zeng Li.

title: To My Beloved Thief
info: To My Beloved Thief () is an upcoming South Korean television series written by Lee Sun, directed by Ham Young-geol, and starring Nam Ji-hyun and Moon Sang-min. The series depicts the story of Hong Eun-jo and Grand General Yi Yeol, whose souls are mysteriously switched, setting off a chain of unexpected events. It is scheduled to premiere on KBS2 on January 3, 2026, and will air every Saturday and Sunday at 21:20 (KST).

title: Marie and Her Three Daddies
info: Marie and Her Three Daddies () is an ongoing South Korean television series starring Ha Seung-ri, Hyun Woo, Park Eun-hye, Ryu Jin, Hwang Dong-joo, and Gong Jung-hwan. The series unfolds as Marie's lifelong search for her father takes a surprising twist when three men unexpectedly enter her life, changing everything. It premiered on KBS1 on October 13, 2025, and airs every Monday to Friday at 20:30 (KST).

title: Last Summer
producer: Pl Han Sang Woo Baek Seung Min Jeong Yeon Ji, Ltref Name, Quotdetail, Quot, Gt
info: Last Summer () is an ongoing South Korean television series written by Jeon Yoo-ri, directed by Min Yeon-hong and starring Lee Jae-wook and Choi Sung-eun. The series depicts two souls, one who shuns warmth and one who craves it, entwined in a summer of self-discovery and love. It premiered on KBS2 on November 1, 2025, and airs every Saturday and Sunday at 21:20 (KST).

title: A Graceful Liar
genre: Family drama, Melodrama, Revenge drama, Romance drama, Thriller film
info: A Graceful Liar () is an ongoing South Korean television series written by Lee Do-hyun, directed by Son Seok-jin, and starring Lee Si-a, Lee Il-hwa, Seol Jung-hwan, Han Ki-woong, and Lee Hyo-na. The series unfolds as a daughter and mother who were bound by blood but separated for many years, becoming embroiled in a twisted game of lies and manipulation when they're reunited as in-laws. It premiered on KBS2 on September 22, 2025, and airs every Monday to Friday at 19:50 (KST).

title: Laws of Attraction
info: Laws of Attraction (Thai: กฎแห่งรักดึงดูด) is a Thai television drama series that aired on One31 from July 15 to September 2, 2023. The series stars Thanapat Kawila (Film) and Rachata Hampanont (Jam) in lead roles.
reception: The series received positive reviews for its blend of legal drama and romantic tension. According to Sanook, the show was praised for its “dark lawyer aesthetic” and strong chemistry between the leads.<ref name="sanook"></ref> MGR Online highlighted the show’s unique narrative structure and emotional depth.<ref name="mgr"></ref> Thairath covered the series extensively, including episode breakdowns and cast interviews.<ref name="thairath"&g...

title: Spirit Fingers
info: Spirit Fingers () is an ongoing South Korean television series starring Park Ji-hu, Jo Joon-young, Choi Bo-min, and Park You-na. Based on Naver Webtoon of the same name by Han Kyoung-chal, it tells the story of Song Woo-yeon, a shy high school student, discovers her voice and passion, learning to express herself and love who she is. It premiered on TVING on October 29, 2025, and airs every Wednesday. It also available for streaming on Viki in selected regions.

title: Human Vapor
info: is an upcoming Japanese-South Korean science fiction thriller television series based on the 1960 tokusatsu film The Human Vapor directed by Ishirō Honda. Written by Yeon Sang-ho and Ryu Yong-jae, and directed by Shinzo Katayama, the series stars Shun Oguri and Yu Aoi in their first live-action collaboration in 23 years. It is a co-production between Toho Studios and South Korea's WOW POINT, marking the first collaboration between Netflix and Toho. The eight-episode limited series is scheduled f...

title: Muteluv
genre: Drama (film and television), Romantic comedy, Supernatural fiction
director: Muangthai Sarupkarn Sasinan Pattana Thachai Komolphet Jarupat Kannula Suwanun Pohgudsai
info: Muteluv (; ; lit. Please Use Discretion in Loving You; stylized as MuTeLuv) is an ongoing Thai supernatural romantic comedy anthology television series produced by GMMTV together with Parbdee Taweesuk. The series consists of seven short stories with each story being split into four episodes, following the various people who use the supernatural forces to achieve their goals, including in finding love. Directed by five directors, it was announced as one of the television series of GMMTV for 2025 ...

title: The 4th Love Revolution
director: Yoon Sung Ho Han In Mi
info: The 4th Love Revolution () is an upcoming South Korean television series starring Kim Yo-han and Hwang Bo-reum-byeol. The series depicts Kang Min-hak, a famous model and influencer, and Joo Yeon-san, a brilliant computer engineering student who's clueless about romance, as they navigate love's ups and downs. It is scheduled to premiere on Wavve on November 13, 2025, at 11:00 (KST).

title: Physical: Asia
producer: Yeom Hye Jeong Choi Ah Hyun Heo Jeong Min
info: Physical: Asia () is a South Korean reality competition series on Netflix. It is a spin-off of Physical: 100 and was announced following the conclusion of the second season. The series will feature 48 contestants from eight countries across Asia, as well as participants from Australia and Turkey, representing a broader pan-Asian and transcontinental competition. They will compete for the title of the ideal physique and a grand prize of ₩1 billion (approximately $700,000 USD as of October 2025). ...

title: Heavenly Hand
director: Wong Lap Kong So Ka Lok Chan Yim Kei Ng Koon Ching
actors: Ali Lee, David Chiang, Brian Tse, Shaun Tam, Rosita Kwok, Willie Wai, Telford Wong, Karen Wu, Stephen Ho, Axity Chong
info: Heavenly Hand (; lit. The Mahjong Orchestra) is a Hong Kong television series created and produced by TVB. Directed by Marco Law, the 25-episode series aired from 28 July to 29 August 2025. Set in Wan Chai, the family-focused drama blends local culture with music, exploring human relationships through mahjong culture and a symphony orchestra. Emphasizing classic TVB storytelling and nostalgia, it stars Shaun Tam and Ali Lee in the lead roles.

title: Pro Bono
director: Kim Seong Yoon Kim Seong Yoon
actors: Jung Kyung Ho, So Joo Yeon, Lee Yoo Young, Yoon Na Moo, Seo Hye Won, Kang Hyung Seok, Choi Dae Hoon
info: Pro Bono () is an upcoming South Korean legal drama television series written by , directed by Kim Seong-yoon, and starring Jung Kyung-ho, So Joo-yeon, and Lee Yoo-young. The series follows a high-achieving but arrogant judge who is forced to become a public interest lawyer. It is scheduled to premiere on tvN on December 6, 2025, and will air every Saturday and Sunday at 21:10 (KST).

title: Draft:Love Doctor
info: Love Doctor () is an upcoming South Korean television series written by Min Hyo-jung, directed by Ahn Pan-seok, and starring Kim So-hyun. The series is about a former swimmer who loses his left leg to illness and a female graduate student who, after feeling lost in her academic path, discovers a new direction in robotics, leading to a romance. It is schedule to premiere on ENA.
